DOC.brief_summary: Compare different corneal parameter visual outcome corneal collagen cross-linking ( CXL ) conventional versus accelerate ultraviolet-A irradiation use riboflavin hydroxypropyl methylcellulose .
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Structural Outcome Conventional Versus Accelerated Corneal Collagen Cross-linking ( CXL ) .
DOC.detailed_description: 40 patient sign progressive keratoconus randomize either corneal collagen cross-linking ( CXL ) conventional ultraviolet-A ( UVA ) irradiation 3 milliwatt/cm² ( mW/ cm² ) accelerate ultraviolet-A ( UVA ) irradiation 9 mW/ cm² . In group riboflavin hydroxypropyl methylcellulose use . The objective study evaluate compare different corneal parameter ( maximum corneal curvature , depth collagen cross-linking , endothelial cell density ) clinical outcome uncorrected visual acuity ( UCVA ) best spectacle correct visual acuity ( BSCVA ) ) CXL conventional accelerate UVA irradiation .
DOC.criteria: Patients increase minimum 1,0 diopter maximum keratometry . Patients increase corneal astigmatism minimum 1,0 diopter . Patients spherical equivalent min 0,5 diopter . Patients live Eastern Norway . Minimum pachymetric corneal thickness ( Pentacam ) < 360 µm . Central corneal scar . Chemical burn , serious corneal infection ocular surface disease . Pregnancy . Lactation .
